Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Cold-Stored vs. Room Temperature Platelet Transfusion in Traumatic Brain Injury

Trial_Design.evidence: A phase 2, single-center, open-label randomized controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were TBI patients requiring platelet transfusion.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomized 1:1 to receive either CSP or RT platelets.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the feasibility, efficacy, and safety of cold-stored platelet (CSP) transfusion compared to room temperature (RT) platelet transfusion in patients with traumatic brain injury (TBI).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was feasibility, and the principal clinical outcome was the 6-month Glasgow Outcome Scale–extended (GOS-E) score.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was performed using a permuted block design, and allocation was concealed from outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From March 17, 2022, to October 18, 2023, 100 patients were randomized (50 to CSP and 50 to RT).

Number_Analysed.evidence: 100 patients were randomized (50 to CSP and 50 to RT).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 6-month GOS-E scores did not differ significantly between groups (OR: 1.58, 95% CI: 0.71 to 3.54, P = 0.27).

Harms.evidence: Adverse event rates were similar across groups.

Funding.evidence: Supported by the U.S. Department of Defense and the University of Pittsburgh.
